intro: Deinbollia kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually simple and alternate. It is adapted to the harsh climate of its habitat, with features that help it conserve water and withstand strong winds. Deinbollia kilimandscharica is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
